content: Hi - I'm the author of RFC#2795. The RFC has just passed its final comment period (hooray!). I'm happy to do the implementation work. This is my first RFC, so I might need to ask a few questions as things go. Is this an appropriate place to ask them?
#t-compiler and #t-compiler/help are good places to ask for help regarding implementation
Thanks. I'm expecting to find the implementation straightforward enough. Most my questions will be around the whole process. (E.g. am I responsible for creating the tracking issue?)
No, the person who merges the RFC PR will create the tracking issue. Though if you want to make their job easier, you can summarize the work that needs doing as a checklist.
You can look at other tracking issues for examples of that.
:thumbs_up: thanks - I'll write up a checklist shortly and add it to the bottom of the RFC discussion, unless someone tells me a better place to put it!
That's a good place to put it.
Just label it "checklist for the tracking issue:"
Thanks again for the proposal and all the work getting it in!
Who should I ping to ask for a tracking issue for https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/issues/2795? I'm keen to get started with a first implementation!
You've come to the right place... we have a few RFCs to merge I think actually,...
:heart: thanks!
